referralLink.title: Simple Arithematic questions on Multiplication
referralLink.description: Are you ready for DKT test? Try simulation test before you go for final test.

referralLink.title: Simple Arithematic questions on Substraction
referralLink.description: Government website for all informationunder one umbrella.

options: No, only N is correct.
Yes. M, N and O are all legal.
Yes, N is best but M and O are quite legal.
questions.qn: If there are no signs or markings to advise you, can you choose any of these methods of parking?

options: Where there are markings or a sign indicating angle park.
Where the road is very wide.
Where there is plenty of room from the centre line.
questions.qn: You should angle park -

options: Maintain your speed, keeping to the limit.
Sound your horn to warn the other driver.
Slow down and pay extra attention.
questions.qn: This bridge has only just enough room for two vehicles. As you come close to it you should -

options: Mirror B.
Mirror A.
Mirror C.
questions.qn: Which side mirror is adjusted best?

options: The building blocks a good view of the side street.
Intersections cause crashes.
It looks a bit tricky.
questions.qn: You should be particularly careful at this intersection because -

options: Go slower because the slower you go the safer you are.
Overtake the bike quickly and speed up to stop the other driver becoming aggressive
Resist the pressure, stay calm and overtake the cyclist when it is safe.
questions.qn: You are in busy traffic and slow down for a bicycle rider. A driver behind you beeps a horn and pressures you to go around the bike and drive faster. How should you respond?

options: Slow down to the speed of other traffic.
Move into the left lane.
Continue at the same speed.
questions.qn: You hear the siren of an ambulance approaching you from behind. You should -

options: Move to the right and make way for the ambulance.
Turn into a driveway on the right hand side of the road.
Move to the left and make way for the ambulance.
questions.qn: You are driving along this road. You hear an ambulance's siren and see the ambulance in your mirror. You should -

options: Stop and let the fire truck overtake you.
Continue and make the turn because you have the right of way
Speed up to beat the fire truck.
questions.qn: You are about to make a right hand turn at this intersection. You have the green light. You hear a siren and then see that a fire truck will soon overtake you. You should -

options: You only have to obey the signs during working hours.
You only have to obey the signs when there are workers about.
You must obey the signs that are displayed at all times.
questions.qn: When you come across roadworks -
What must you do if you miss your exit on a freeway?
options: Continue until you reach the next appropriate exit.
Stop, and reverse back along the freeway to the exit you missed
Stop immediately and turn around.

questions.qn: As you leave a freeway, which of the following should you check?
options: Fuel gauge.
Your speed.
Windscreen wipers.

questions.qn: When can a private car travel in a lane marked by this sign?
options: When carrying at least two passengers.
Only within 100 metres of making a turn.
Only to overtake another vehicle.

questions.qn: Are you permitted to drive a car towing more than one trailer?
options: Yes, provided you have held a licence for two years.
Yes, if the combined length of vehicle and trailers does not exceed 15 metres.
No, not at all.

questions.qn: What must you do when you are towing a caravan to help other vehicles overtake?
options: Keep at least 60 metres behind heavy vehicles or other vehicles towing caravans.
Drive at least 25 km/h below the speed limit.
Stop immediately and let the faster vehicle overtake.
School children crossing the road ahead, prepare to stop.
Traffic controller ahead, slow down and be prepared to stop.
Traffic lights out of order, Police on duty ahead.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Steep down-grade in the road ahead, slow down.
Road under repair, slow down
Road ahead slippery when wet, drive carefully.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: A divided road is ahead, prepare for a change in traffic conditions.
Freeway conditions are ahead, maximum speed is 100 km/h.
A two lane bridge is ahead, slow down and drive carefully.
questions.qn: You should expect this sign, when -

options: Red light camera in use at traffic lights ahead.
Intersection ahead with traffic lights, prepare to stop
Railway level crossing with flashing signals ahead, slow down, drive carefully, and be prepared to stop.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Form one lane of traffic
Road narrows ahead, slow down and prepare for a change in traffic conditions.
Merging traffic, give way to your right.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Vehicles are not allowed to stop at the kerb except in a medical emergency.
Vehicles must not stop at the kerb, unless picking up goods
Vehicles must not stop at the kerb, except if picking up a passenger
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Motor cars carrying one passenger may use this lane.
This lane is reserved for bicycle riders only.
Vehicles carrying three or more people, and motorcycles may use this lane.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Give way sign ahead, slow down and be prepared to stop
Railway level crossing ahead, slow down and look out for trains, be prepared to stop.
Cattle or sheep crossing the road ahead, drive slowly.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Take a break, rest area ahead.
Take care, trucks crossing the road ahead.
Drive carefully and watch out for traffic entering from a side-road intersection ahead.
questions.qn: When you see this sign, you should -

options: Stop at the stop line and give way to all traffic.
Stop at the stop line and give way to all traffic on your right only.
Slow down and be prepared to stop only if there is any danger of a collision with another vehicle or pedestrian.
questions.qn: When you see this sign you must -

options: Be able to drive the same as you normally can.
Be able to pay close attention to details in the traffic.
Misjudge speed (your own and others).
questions.qn: After drinking alcohol you could -

options: Wait for one hour after your last drink before you drive home.
Organise before hand a way of getting home where you are not the driver.
After you have had a few drinks, start to think about how you will get home.
questions.qn: If you are going out and going to drink alcohol, the best way to avoid having to drink and drive is to -

options: More serious.
Less serious.
About the same
questions.qn: When drivers have been drinking, the crashes they are involved in are generally -

options: About 50%.
About 30%.
About 10%.
questions.qn: On Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights, how many serious crashes involve alcohol?

options: Yes, if there is no danger of colliding with another vehicle.
Yes, at all times
No, unless there is a U-TURN PERMITTED sign at the intersection
questions.qn: Are you permitted to make a U-Turn at traffic lights?

options: Can turn left, but not go straight ahead.
Can turn left or go straight ahead.
Can turn left only if a sign 'TURN LEFT AT ANY TIME WITH CARE' is displayed.
questions.qn: These lights mean that you -

options: Turn off the busy street and wait for traffic to clear.
Keep up with the other traffic because it's probably safe if the sign says 60 km/h.
Slow down to a speed that suits the conditions.
questions.qn: You are driving in busy traffic in a 60 km/h zone. You feel 60 km/h is a bit too fast for the conditions. What should you do?

options: A letter of warning and a small fine.
Fines only.
Fines, demerit points and possibly loss of licence.
questions.qn: What could be the penalties for driving over the speed limit -

options: Drive carefully, and watch out for kangaroos entering the road for the next 30 km.
Zoo 30 km ahead.
Nature reserve 30 km ahead.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Are only needed on short trips.
Are only needed on long trips.
Must always be worn properly, and adjusted tightly.
questions.qn: Seat belts and child restraints (eg baby capsules and child seats) -

options: Need only be used if the child wants to sleep.
Are not as safe as holding a child in your arms.
Should be fitted according to the manufacturers' instructions.
questions.qn: Child restraints (eg, baby capsules and child seats) -

options: Sound your horn to warn other drivers.
Unbuckle your seat belt so you can reverse as quickly as possible.
Take care and never reverse for a greater distance and time than is necessary.
questions.qn: When reversing, you should -

options: May overtake the vehicle provided no cars are coming the other way.
May overtake the vehicle if there are no pedestrians on the crossing.
Must not overtake the stopped vehicle.
questions.qn: A vehicle ahead of you has stopped at a pedestrian crossing. You -

options: Are out of sight
Reach the right-hand side of the crossing.
Are off the crossing and the hand held sign is taken away.
questions.qn: If you see a School Crossing Supervisor holding a sign like this, you must wait until the children -

options: The lane carrying the least amount of traffic.
The far right-hand lane or any other lane having an arrow pointing right.
The far left-hand lane.
questions.qn: Right-turns must be made from which lanes when travelling on a laned roadway?

options: Vehicle P.
Vehicle O.
It depends on who moves first.
questions.qn: In this diagram both vehicles O and P must pass through GIVE WAY signs before entering the intersection. Which vehicle goes first?

options: The driver of the vehicle signals it is safe to do so.
An oncoming car appears over a hill.
You can see the overtaken vehicle in your rear vision mirror.
questions.qn: When overtaking another vehicle you should NOT move back in front of it, unless -

options: Keep to the left and let that driver overtake you.
Speed up so that the driver will not have to overtake.
Signal the driver to remain behind you if it is travelling too fast.
questions.qn: A driver behind you signals their intention to overtake your car. What should you do?

options: Be easier to steer and handle
Take longer and further to stop.
Be heavier to steer.
questions.qn: When driving on a slippery wet road, for example, one covered in early morning dew, your vehicle will -

options: Your wheels may skid and cause a loss of control.
If the wheels lock up your handbrake may not work.
You might wet pedestrians walking along the footpath.
questions.qn: Why should you avoid heavy braking on a wet road?
